skill.name: fiftyone-find-duplicates
skill.description: Find duplicate or near-duplicate images in FiftyOne datasets using brain similarity computation. Use when users want to deduplicate datasets, find similar images, cluster visually similar content, or remove redundant samples. Requires FiftyOne MCP server with @voxel51/brain plugin installed.
skill.summary: Find duplicate or near-duplicate images in FiftyOne datasets using brain similarity computation. Use...
skill.author: AdonaiVera

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and guidance text. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access is included. The skill guides AI assistants to use pre-existing FiftyOne MCP server tools for dataset operations.

content.value_statement: Duplicate images waste storage space and bias machine learning models. This skill uses deep learning embeddings to identify and remove exact duplicates and near-duplicate images from FiftyOne datasets. It automates the detection process and helps you clean datasets before training.
actual_capabilities: Find exact duplicate images by file content
Detect near-duplicate images using deep learning embeddings
Sort images by visual similarity to a reference sample
Generate duplicate group IDs for review and cleanup
Deduplicate datasets while keeping one representative per group
Launch and interact with FiftyOne App for visual review
limitations: Requires FiftyOne MCP server with @voxel51/brain plugin installed
Embedding computation time scales with dataset size
Does not run standalone; depends on external MCP tools
Only works with image datasets in FiftyOne format

use_cases.title: Clean Training Datasets
use_cases.description: Remove duplicate images to prevent model bias and reduce storage costs before training.

use_cases.title: Analyze Image Collections
use_cases.description: Find visually similar images in large datasets for clustering and analysis tasks.

use_cases.title: Deduplicate Research Data
use_cases.description: Clean up collected image data by removing redundant or near-identical samples.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Duplicate Search
prompt_templates.scenario: Find all duplicates in a dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: Find and remove duplicate images in my FiftyOne dataset called '[dataset-name]'. First compute embeddings, then find near duplicates, and show me the results in the app.

prompt_templates.title: Threshold Tuning
prompt_templates.prompt: Find near-duplicate images in [dataset-name] with a lower threshold of 0.1 to catch only very similar images. Show the duplicate groups in the app for review.

prompt_templates.title: Exact vs Near Duplicates
prompt_templates.prompt: First find and remove exact duplicate files in [dataset-name], then find near-duplicates with threshold 0.3 and show me the groups.

prompt_templates.title: Similarity Search
prompt_templates.scenario: Find images similar to a sample
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the 20 images most similar to sample ID [sample-id] in [dataset-name]. Sort them by similarity and display in the app.

output_examples.input: Find duplicate images in my training-dataset
output: Near duplicates found: 3 groups with 12 total images
Run deduplicate_near_duplicates to remove duplicates while keeping representatives.

best_practices: Start with the default threshold of 0.3 and adjust based on results
Review duplicates visually in the FiftyOne App before deleting
Use the same brain_key when reusing embeddings for multiple operations
anti_patterns: Do not skip the visual review step before deleting duplicates
Do not use thresholds above 0.5 for large datasets without testing
Do not forget to close the app after completing operations

faq.question: What FiftyOne version do I need?
faq.answer: FiftyOne 0.21 or later with MCP server installed and @voxel51/brain plugin enabled.

faq.question: How many images can this process?
faq.answer: Works with any size. Expect ~1-2 minutes per 1,000 images for embedding computation.

faq.question: Can I use my own embedding model?
faq.answer: Yes. Specify any model supported by FiftyOne when calling compute_similarity operator.

faq.question: Is my data safe during processing?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why do I need to launch the app?
faq.answer: Brain operators are delegated and require the FiftyOne App executor for UI operations.

faq.question: How is this different from simple hash matching?
faq.answer: Uses deep learning embeddings to find visually similar images, not just identical files.
